column4: Hi.. i'm trying to use grysnc to backup some files, ext2 -> ext2... it copies them all every time... It seems that its the time that isnt matching, since setting "size only" fixes this. any ideas?
are the clocks on both machines correct?
- Its the same machine
does rsync work without a hitch?
if you diff one pair of files, is anything reported?
- They're exactly the same... its got to be something to do with the time
what is the exact rsync command you use?
- rsync -r -n -p -o -g -v --progress <in> <out>
- Also, using preserve-time has no effect, but setting size-only does (but isnt a good solution for me)
-Looking at the files the times dont match, but everything else does
and a simple "rsync -av" has the same problem? also, i assume you left the -n option out?
- Which is -n again?
the "dry-run" switch :-) also, did you try enabling -t?
- Ah of course :) -t didnt make much difference, but its working again now
with which switches?
sans -n :-)
that's always sensible
if you've a long list to check, try "md5sum -c <filename>"
where the file given is the md5sum list
- Ah thanks, thats what I was looking for... thought it was more difficult :)
i think it's available as a theme under gdmsetup. might be mistaken about that.
- Cant see it
try "apt-cache search gdm", and look for relevant theme packages. might be there still.
- Seems like to used to be called human but isnt there anymore, just the new metal one
